experiments.name: NLP for Question Answering
experiments.head: Blog
experiments.description: Ongoing posts and code documenting the process of building a question answering model.

experiments.name: Interpretability Revisited: SHAP and LIME
experiments.head: Notebook
experiments.description: Explore how to use LIME and SHAP for interpretability.

experiments.name: Interpretability Report
experiments.head: Report
experiments.description: Learn about using interpretability techniques on deep learning models.

experiments.name: Refractor
experiments.head: Prototype
experiments.description: Refractor predicts churn probabilities for telecom customers and shows which customer attributes contribute to those predictions.

experiments.name: Anomagram
experiments.head: Prototype
experiments.description: An interactive visualization tool for exploring how a deep learning model can be applied to the task of anomaly detection.

experiments.name: Deep Learning for Anomaly Detection
experiments.head: Report
experiments.description: Learn how to use deep learning approaches (including sequence models, VAEs, and GANS) for anomaly detection.

experiments.name: Blip
experiments.head: Prototype
experiments.description: Blip visualizes how four different anomaly detection algorithms perform at detecting network attacks.

experiments.name: Squote
experiments.head: Demo
experiments.description: A semantic search engine that takes some input text and returns relevant famous quotes.

experiments.name: Textflix Report
experiments.head: Report
experiments.description: Learn about how we used transfer learning and a pretrained BERT model to build our sentiment analysis prototype.

experiments.name: Textflix
experiments.head: Prototype
experiments.description: Textflix uses movie reviews to show how machine learning can unlock the data embedded in large amounts of unstructured text.

experiments.name: ConvNet Playground
experiments.head: Prototype
experiments.description: With ConvNet Playground you can explore how a convolutional neural network does semantic image search.

experiments.name: Weak supervision with Snorkel
experiments.head: Notebook
experiments.description: A notebook showing how to train a complaint classifier with Snorkel. Using data from the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau.

experiments.name: Active Learner
experiments.head: Prototype
experiments.description: An interactive visualization of active learning data labeling strategies for supervised machine learning.

experiments.name: Handtrack.js
experiments.head: Library
experiments.description: Handtrack.js is a library for prototyping realtime hand detection (bounding box), directly in the browser.

experiments.name: UMAP Explorer
experiments.head: Demo
experiments.description: An interactive UMAP visualization of the MNIST data set.

experiments.name: Active Learning with Logistic Regression
experiments.head: Demo
experiments.description: A toy example about logistic regression and different active learning strategies.

experiments.name: Turbofan Tycoon
experiments.head: Prototype
experiments.description: See if you have what it takes to make it as a turbofan factory owner in our federated learning prototype.

experiments.name: Probabilistic Real Estate
experiments.head: Prototype
experiments.description: A probabilistic programming prototype that predicts future real estate prices across New York City boroughs and neighborhoods.

experiments.name: Brief Preview
experiments.head: Prototype
experiments.description: Brief uses neural networks to score and highlight the most interesting sentences within any article.

experiments.name: Using three.js for 2D Data Visualization
experiments.head: Tutorial
experiments.description: An interactive notebook about using three.js to render tens of thousands of points.

experiments.name: Encartopedia
experiments.head: Demo
experiments.description: Encartopedia visualizes Wikipedia topic clusters and plots your journey through them.

experiments.name: Visualizing the Taste of a Community of Cinephiles
experiments.head: Demo
experiments.description: An interactive visualization that uses T-SNE to cluster movies together based on user ratings.

experiments.name: Luhn Method Demo
experiments.head: Demo
experiments.description: Luhn's method, from 1958, provides a foundation for understanding modern auto-summarization techniques.
